title: Why are people so unappreciative?
body:
38 kills carried and I would have thought that the team would show me some gratitude but I guess not. Some kids out there upset they have to put some of their own effort into winning the game. Pathetic.

edit: how do I words?    -_-

replies.body: you literally just posted this to brag. nobody cares kid, relax your hole

Why are people so arrogant? Kills aren't everything. In fact, it's often kill-hungry players lke you who make games last so long in the first place. If you're so far ahead, why not just provide pressure via your presence and use that pressure to destroy structures? It would win the game a lot faster than farming kills all day.

not going to lie, i really enjoy the imput you have on the boards. :)

+1
I appreciate the vote of confidence, but really I'm a bit of an ass.

There's being an arsehole, and being blunt yet constructive.

your the latter

> [{quoted}](name=Strat,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=qfEvKtEr,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-07-28T10:21:26.768+0000)
>
> Kills aren't everything. 

THAT. IS. THE. POINT. I had so many kills because I was going out of my way to get them to help the rest of the team supposedly fulfill their own roles and shove their own lanes but nope. It got worse the longer the game dragged on because of the BIG FUCKING THREAT target over my head meant I was dead after pretty much every team fight. Team would not push and...well, I CAN'T TAKE TOWERS WHEN I'M **DEAD**.

Farming kills gives the enemy team time to catch up surprisingly enough if you don't put pressure on the lead you have.

One of the seven deadly sins is greed guys, even the bible knows not to do this, come on.
Plot Twist: DianasGotSwag had the lowest number of kills out of the whole team.
